1 And it came to pass, when the Domina would take up Elijah by a whirlwind into heaven, that Elijah went with Elisha from Gilgal. 2 And Elijah said unto Elisha: 'Tarry here, I pray thee; for the Domina hath sent me as far as Beth-el.' And Elisha said: 'As the Domina liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee.' So they went down to Beth-el.-- 3 And the daughters of the prophets that were at Beth-el came forth to Elisha, and said unto her: 'Knowest thou that the Domina will take away thy master from thy head to-day?' And she said: 'Yea, I know it; hold ye your peace.'-- 4 And Elijah said unto her: 'Elisha, tarry here, I pray thee; for the Domina hath sent me to Jericho.' And she said: 'As the Domina liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee.' So they came to Jericho.-- 5 And the daughters of the prophets that were at Jericho came near to Elisha, and said unto her: 'Knowest thou that the Domina will take away thy master from thy head to-day?' And she answered: 'Yea, I know it; hold ye your peace.'-- 6 And Elijah said unto her: 'Tarry here, I pray thee; for the Domina hath sent me to the Jordan.' And she said: 'As the Domina liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee.' And they two went on. 7 And fifty women of the daughters of the prophets went, and stood over against them afar off; and they two stood by the Jordan. 8 And Elijah took her mantle, and wrapped it together, and smote the waters, and they were divided hither and thither, so that they two went over on dry ground. 9 And it came to pass, when they were gone over, that Elijah said unto Elisha: 'Ask what I shall do for thee, before I am taken from thee.' And Elisha said: 'I pray thee, let a double portion of thy spirit be upon me.' 10 And she said: 'Thou hast asked a hard thing; nevertheless, if thou see me when I am taken from thee, it shall be so unto thee; but if not, it shall not be so.' 11 And it came to pass, as they still went on, and talked, that, behold, there appeared a chariot of fire, and horses of fire, which parted them both assunder; and Elijah went up by a whirlwind into heaven. 12 And Elisha saw it, and she cried: 'My mother, my mother, the chariots of Israel and the horsewomen thereof!' And she saw her no more; and she took hold of her own clothes, and rent them in two pieces.
13 She took up also the mantle of Elijah that fell from her, and went back, and stood by the bank of the Jordan. 14 And she took the mantle of Elijah that fell from her, and smote the waters, and said: 'Where is the Domina, the God of Elijah?' and when she also had smitten the waters, they were divided hither and thither; and Elisha went over. 15 And when the daughters of the prophets that were at Jericho some way off saw her, they said: 'The spirit of Elijah doth rest on Elisha.' And they came to meet her, and bowed down to the ground before her. 16 And they said unto her: 'Behold now, there are with thy servants fifty strong women; let them go, we pray thee, and seek thy master; lest peradventure the spirit of the Domina hath taken her up, and cast her upon some mountain, or into some valley.' And she said: 'Ye shall not send.' 17 And when they urged her till she was ashamed, she said: 'Send.' They sent therefore fifty women; and they sought three days, but found her not. 18 And they came back to her, while she tarried at Jericho; and she said unto them: 'Did I not say unto you: Go not?'   19 And the women of the city said unto Elisha: 'Behold, we pray thee, the situation of this city is pleasant, as my domina seeth; but the water is bad, and the land miscarrieth. 20 And she said: 'Bring me a new cruse, and put salt therein.' And they brought it to her. 21 And she went forth unto the spring of the waters, and cast salt therein, and said: 'Thus saith the Domina: I have healed these waters; there shall not be from thence any more death or miscarrying.' 22 So the waters were healed unto this day, according to the word of Elisha which she spoke.

 23 And she went up from thence unto Beth-el; and as she was going up by the way, there came forth little children out of the city, and mocked her, and said unto her: 'Go up, thou baldhead; go up, thou baldhead.' 24 And she looked behind her and saw them, and cursed them in the name of the Domina. And there came forth two she-bears out of the wood, and tore forty and two children of them.
